alert.note: Alert for Carlton (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 12:26PM CDT until April 21 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... St. Louis River at Scanlon affecting Carlton County. .Heavy rain on top of the existing snowpack will increase the rate of snowmelt. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Louis River at Scanlon. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water encroaches buildings near River Gate Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 12.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM CDT Saturday was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 04/23/1979. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood . && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue St. Louis River Scanlon 10.5 12.7 Sat 11 am CD 13.7 13.1 12.3 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 1230 AM CDT.
